problem_text:
∗2.48. (N. Aronszajn). Let G be a connected topological group locally satisfying
some identical relation f|U = 1, where U is a neighborhood of the identity element
of G. Is it then true that f|G = 1?
V. P. Platonov
answer:
∗No, not necessarily: for any odd integer n ⩾1010 there is a connected topological
group such that the identity xn = 1 holds in some neighborhood of unity, but not
in the entire group (E. Reznichenko, I. Zyabrev, Preprint, 2024, https://arxiv.org/
abs/2406.05203).
